channel.title: Experienced Coders Please Read!
channel.description:
Hey, Ive got a 562 Server and the Base is RS2HD. Im Stuck on these Things:
[s] - How would I Change Server Messages?[/s] - Two Of my Shops are Glitched, For More Info go [url=http://tinypic.com/r/zkj3g0/7]Here[/url] - When you Trade it doesnt say what you will get and recieve on the second screen. - Admins Cannot trade - Admins Dont Loose their Items on Death in the Wildy. - When you drop Items they Disapppear [s] - How can I Make it so The Players Save Inside the Server (Not on a NotePad which can be Easily Looked at and Hacked) - How can I Make it so I only Need to run One Batch File Instead of Two? - How would I Make an UnPnPc? [/s]
Thanks a Lot! (I will Rep++ for an answer)

item.title: Experienced Coders Please Read!
item.dc:creator: @dds_ledg dds ledg
item.description:
@dds_ledg wrote:

In your video i cant exactly see your codes that are messed up, can you post them.
Ah, Ok. Heres the Codes: [code] case 9:// Shop Case p.shopId = 9; p.getActionSender().sendString("PK Shop", 620, 22); shopopen(p, 9); items = GameEngine.shops.pvpshop; itemsN = GameEngine.shops.pvpshopN; p.getActionSender().sendItems( -1, 64209, 93, p.getInventory().getContainer());//Shop Inventory p.getActionSender().sendItems( -1, 63746, 556, items, itemsN); break; case 8: p.shopId = 8; p.getActionSender().sendString("Armour Shop", 620, 22); shopopen(p, 8); items = GameEngine.shops.Armour; itemsN = GameEngine.shops.ArmourN; p.getActionSender().sendItems( -1, 64209, 93, p.getInventory().getContainer());//Shop Inventory p.getActionSender().sendItems( -1, 63746, 556, items, itemsN); break; NOW HERES ONE THAT WAS HERE ALREADY! 
				case 12:
				p.shopId = 12;
		p.getActionSender().sendString("Training Shop", 620, 22);
		shopopen(p, 12);
      		items = GameEngine.shops.TrainingShop;
       		itemsN = GameEngine.shops.TrainingShopN;
        		p.getActionSender().sendItems( -1, 64209, 93, p.getInventory().getContainer());//Shop Inventory
        		p.getActionSender().sendItems( -1, 63746, 556, items, itemsN);
    	break;

[/code]
Of Course they are not in that Order but i figured they’re the ones you needed to know.
Now, Above all of these Cases are the Codes which handle what you get back:

				case 9:
				switch (buttonId2) {//Pk shop
					case 0:return 391;
					case 1:return 385;
					case 2:return 2434;
					case 3:return 2436;
					case 4:return 2442;
					case 5:return 2440;
					case 6:return 7453;
					case 7:return 7454;
					case 8:return 7455;
					case 9:return 7456;
					case 10:return 7457;
					case 11:return 7458;
					case 12:return 7459;
					case 13:return 7460;
					case 14:return 7461;
					case 15:return 5698;
					case 16:return 4587;
					case 17:return 1434;
					case 18:return 4151;
					case 19:return 6109;
					case 20:return 6107;
					case 21:return 6108;
					case 22:return 6110;
					case 23:return 6106;
					case 24:return 6111;
					case 25:return 861;
					case 26:return 892;
					case 27:return 4675;
					case 28:return 3840;
					case 29:return 3841;
					case 30:return 3842;
					case 31:return 1725;
					case 32:return 1704;
				}
			break;
				case 8:
				switch (buttonId2) {//Armour shop
				case 0:return 1155;
				case 1:return 1117;
				case 2:return 1075;
				case 3:return 1189;
				case 4:return 4119;
				case 5:return 1153;
				case 6:return 1115;
				case 7:return 1067;
				case 8:return 1191;
				case 9:return 4121;
				case 10:return 1157;
				case 11:return 1119;
				case 12:return 1069;
				case 13:return 1193;
				case 14:return 4123;
				case 15:return 1165;
				case 16:return 1125;
				case 17:return 1077;
				case 18:return 1159;
				case 19:return 1121;
				case 20:return 1071;
				case 21:return 1197;
				case 22:return 4127;
				case 23:return 1161;
				case 24:return 1123;
				case 25:return 1073;
				case 26:return 1199;
				case 27:return 4129;
				case 28:return 1163;
				case 29:return 1127;
				case 30:return 1079;
				case 31:return 1201;
				}
			break;
                                                    NOW FOR THE REAL ONE:
            case 12:
                switch (buttonId2) {//Training Shop
                    case 0:return 11037;
					case 1:return 1540;
					case 2:return 10828;
					case 3:return 1305;
					case 4:return 7158;
					case 5:return 5698;
					case 6:return 1079;
					case 7:return 1093;
					case 8:return 1127;
					case 9:return 1163;
					case 10:return 1067;
					case 11:return 1081;
					case 12:return 1115;
					case 13:return 1153;
					case 14:return 1323;
					case 15:return 3105;
					case 16:return 9185;
					case 17:return 15241;
					case 18:return 15243;
					case 19:return 15126;
					case 20:return 4587;
                }
                break;

Now, In Shops.Java i think the code is for the items that acturly show up in the Shops.

public int[] pvpshop = {391,385,2434,2436,2442,2440,7453,7454,7455,7456,7457,7458,7459,7460,7461,5698,4587,1434,4151,6109,6107,6108,6110,6106,6111,861,892,4675,3840,3841,3842,1725,1704};
public int[] pvpshopN = {10000,10000,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100,100};
public int[] Armour = {1155, 1117, 1075, 1189, 4119, 1153, 1067, 1191, 4121, 1157, 1119, 1069, 1193, 4123, 1165, 1125, 1077, 1159, 1121, 1071, 1197, 4127, 1161, 1123, 1073, 1199, 4129, 1163, 1127, 1079, 1201};
public int[] ArmourN = {100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100};
                                                      REAL ONE:
public int[] TrainingShop = {11037,1540,10828,1305,7158,5698,1079,1093,1127,1163,1067,1081,1115,1153,1323,3105,9185,15241,15243,15126,4587};
public int[] TrainingShopN = {1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000,1000};

Also in SummonPacketHandler you need to add which Npc Gets the Shops. Heres the Code for them + a Real one:

case 549:
GameEngine.shopHandler.openshop(p, 8);
break;
case 534:
GameEngine.shopHandler.openshop(p, 9);
break;
                                            REAL ONE
case 550:
GameEngine.shopHandler.openshop(p, 12);
break;

Theres the Codes, if you can see the Problem please tell me.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Rash, post:18, topic:382843”]There is something in your drop handler which is saying that admins cannot drop.
You need to find it and remove it.[/quote]

item.title: Experienced Coders Please Read!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“dds ledg, post:31, topic:382843”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=478629.msg3506899#msg3506899 date=1298216631]
i think there is a void about dropping items, try searching your client.java for something like if (dropped) or somethin, if not look for keywords: item, void, dropped. Oh, and for server messages, try searching them in your search.jar
[/quote]
OMG DUDE THANK YOU SO MUCH, I HAVE BEEN SEARCHING FOR EVER TO TRY AND CHANGE THE SERVER MESSAGES! :D[/quote]
Lol thats how i first learned to change my server messages, so i figured, hey, it might work for him. and it did. In your video i cant exactly see your codes that are messed up, can you post them.
And heres a snippit from my run.bat for my client, not server
@echo off
COLOR 09
title SkibblezScape client V3
@echo Client Is loading…
@echo -----------------------
javaw -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32
pause

if you notice at the end of it i added the word pause. now what that does is it freezes it on the very first screen it loads on. if you add that to the bottom of your clients run.bat it will do the same. now heres the magical part of it. as soon as your cmd opens with that, you can go ahead and close it. it will still open and run just like normal, but without junking up your screen or preformance of the computer

Read full topic

item.title: Experienced Coders Please Read!
item.dc:creator: @dds_ledg dds ledg
item.description:
@dds_ledg wrote:

[quote=“Rash, post:16, topic:382843”][quote author=dds ledg link=topic=478629.msg3506647#msg3506647 date=1298196979]

For admins can’t trade / doesn’t drop items on death
find your trading and/or your death method and there should be something like

if (p.rights > 2){ //shit blocking them from trading or dropping items on death }
Post it here if you are unsure before deleting it.

Where abouts would you say the files are in, I found Trade.Java and DeathEvent.java but there was nothing in there to do with Admins…

Look in your drop handler.

I dont have one…
[/quote]

You have to have one.
What file handles the dropping?[/quote]
I Dont Know; This is a Picture of my Packethandler:
